item.title: Dog fouling, 23rd November
item.description:
There is dog mess on the street, and it's the 4th or 5th time it's happened, so there is clearly an issue with someone not picking it up.

item.title: Bin not emptied, 23rd November
item.description:
The rubbish bin on the green has not been emptied. It appears to have been missed. It is overflowing with dog poo bags and the strong winds are "redistributing" the bags around the bin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Pendil Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Addition to previously reported issue, 23rd November
item.description:
Please find enclosed screenshots showing some of the locations where rivers run down the pavement adjacent to leckhampton road. you will see other areas of violet in the screenshot, that is where I also took photos of lakes. Please note this is not due to leaves, there is simply nowhere for water to drain, and existing drainage cannot cope with the undulating nature that is now the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: All 4 drop kerbs are damaged and unusable by wheelchairs, 23rd November
item.description:
The drop kerbs either side of Ormond Place as you're going into the arcade and towards Decathlon. It's all 4 of them on either side of the road. I am unable to navigate these drop kerbs and have to go into the road or go the very long way around to the front entrance of the arcade on the high street in order to go in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Ormond Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 23rd November
item.description:
Drain on roundabout near St Andrewâ€™s Church is still blocked. Water then flows across road and down Station Road passed Churchdown Junior School. Traffic then flows through the water causing splashing on to footpaths. This drain has been blocked for many many months, thought issue may have been looked at when road recently resurfaced, but obviously not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement is in pieces, 23rd November
item.description:
The pavement on both sides of Malvern Road is severely broken up with large holes and tree roots making it extremely hard to walk and dangerous for those with disabilities or young children
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham

item.title: The problem is at the cattlegrid/drainage on the byway part of Greenway lane (higher up the map than shown). Works have been undertaken to clear the cattlegrid but they haven't sufficiently cleared the path to the left of it to ensure the lathe remains accessible to horse riders who are frequent users and arguably also less sure footed pedestrians!o, 22nd November
item.description:
What 3 words location roughly ///purely.trappings.baseballs The cattlegrid is approx 100m after the footpath across the back of the Greenway hotel. Greenway lane isn't shown as a byway on your map. Issue noticed today. This is a really key riding route for local equestrians. We won't be able to use it until it is made safe. So any help appreciated! Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow lines on Merestones Road worn out, 22nd November
item.description:
This issue has been reported a number of times previously and appears to be wilfully ignored by the Local Authorities. These are so worn out that people are ignoring them and parking causing major issues at peak times for traffic travelling to and from the Merestones estate. The response given previously is nothing short of facetious and meaningless - "This enquiry has been addressed, no further updates will be shared here" Nothing has been done and the dangerous situation continues - when will some proper action be taken before someone is seriously hurt?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Merestones Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Overgrown trees forcing kerb stones into road in Kensington Ave. damage to cars occurring, 22nd November
item.description:
The overgrown trees have huge roots that are now lifting the kerb stones and the road tarmac in Kensington Ave. Can you book replacement or resetting of the kerb stones? They are lethal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge purposely damaged, 22nd November

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stump Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
